name: Whispering Sands Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Whispering Sands is a nice, clean place to stay when passing through this part of Utah. The owners are friendly and accommodating, and the rooms are spacious, clean and well-maintained. They even have free, satellite-delivered (slow) wireless internet service for guests.
reviews.title: Nice, clean motel in a remote town

likes.liked: — Good, clean rooms in an out-of-the-way place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hanksville is the definition of a tiny junction town, but is very convenient for the little known but very attractive Capital Reef National Park. It's a dry and dusty place with little but a couple of motels and gas stations, and a house boat park (?!) As with so many of these small town eateries, the diner across the road (Blondies) seems to close when the staff feel like it.
reviews.title: Convenient reasonable stop in middle of nowhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, the motel is well back from the road, hence very quiet. The room was a reasonable size, and had a fridge, but no coffee maker. Bathroom was fine, bedroom reasonably clean. Wifi is advertised, but I could only connect by walking to the office (which was closed) and sitting on the bench out front. Tricky in mid-summer sunlight. Reception desk was ok (when manned) but not overly welcoming.
reviews.title: A good place to stay if you need to stay in Hanksville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd stay again in view of the lack of anything better. The driving to it through Capitol Reef, and from it through Glen Canyon, is outstanding.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If this motel were in a larger town, I'd probably give it 3 stars. But Hanksville is kind of the middle of nowhere. We wanted to stay there for a few days, and were glad to find the Whispering Sands. If I decide to stay in the area again, I would not hesitate to stay here.
reviews.title: Move on

likes.disliked: — setting, reception, price, Lake Powell boating crowd

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having said that, you should understand that Hanksville is not a tourist town, or much of a town at all. You can't really hold that against the motel. If you want to go out and see things near Hanksville, but you don't want to stay in one of the more developed towns that would require considerably more driving time to return to in the evening (so that you can spend a few more hours doing something other than driving back to your motel) then this is the place for you. But if you're looking for stuff to do other than sleep once you get back to town, this may not be the town for you.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

description: This Hanksville motel gives you a great central location in the grand circle of southern Utah's national parks; this is why Whispering Sands Motel is premium Hanksville lodging. Enjoy the Satellite TV, wireless internet, air conditioning, and clean/comfy rooms that do include Fridge, microwave, coffee maker, hairdryer.
